image.altText: Western Australia Police Force sign over the doors of police headquarters in Perth.

items.synopsis: WA's police union says its members have accepted the state government's wage policy, ending a long-running and heated period of negotiations.

title.children: WA police 'begrudgingly' accept wage offer as nurses and firefighters continue to hold out

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt speaks with older Indigenous women.

items.synopsis: Indigenous leaders from across WA's North West have used the return of a landmark bush meeting, which was attended by Richard Marles and Linda Burney, to call for a genuine, grassroots approach to dealing with their remote communities.

title.children: Pilbara Indigenous leaders back Voice, but say 'real understanding' still lacking

image.altText: A cyclist in professional gear riding down a street.

items.synopsis: Up-and-coming cyclist Connor Lambert, 25, died after he was hit by a truck while training in Europe.

title.children: Tributes flow for WA cyclist killed while training in Belgium

image.altText: A woman in a hard hat has her back to the camera and stands on Whakaari.

items.synopsis: The criminal trial into the Whakaari White Island disaster in New Zealand hears evidence from its first Australian witness, including details of their harrowing journey back to the mainland.

title.children: After she was covered in hot volcanic ash, travel blogger Annie endured a horrifying journey to get help

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith arrives at court

items.synopsis: A judge who dismissed Ben Roberts-Smith’s defamation case placed weight on unreliable or improbable accounts from witnesses and "cherry-picked" from the testimony of others, the war veteran will argue during an appeal.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith judge accused of 'cherry-picking' evidence as war veteran's lawyers launch appeal

image.altText: The back of a man's RSPCA uniform.

items.synopsis: Layla the dog was shot while sleeping on a chair in the driveway of a Cable Beach home, sparking a police investigation.

title.children: Chihuahua dies after being shot with arrow in Broome suburb

image.altText: A woman sits at a table typing on a laptop in front of a white wall. An artwork next to her of an eyeball appears to look at her

items.synopsis: Thousands of Australian public sector staff will be allowed to permanently work from home following a "groundbreaking" union deal — but business lobby groups in one capital city say any move to follow suit at local level would be a "death knell" for CBD retail.

title.children: Work-from-home deal 'groundbreaking', but business groups warn of CBD 'death knell'

image.altText: a handful of free-range eggs

items.synopsis: An egg industry advocate says farmers will need to be compensated if a suggested end date for battery hens in Australia becomes a reality.

title.children: End date endorsed for caged eggs but states, territories left to make final call

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

items.synopsis: As the government weighs whether to keep or replace Philip Lowe as RBA governor, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says two key candidates from Treasury and Finance should be ruled out of the running.

title.children: Former RBA governor says Dutton 'silly to rule out' candidates from Treasury and Finance as next Reserve Bank head

image.altText: Aerial shot of a rescue boat and a capsized fishing boat.

items.synopsis: A Geraldton man walks away injury-free after being rescued from his capsized boat off WA's midwest coast.

title.children: Fisherman lucky to be alive after being stranded offshore by king wave

image.altText: Observation cell Banksia Hill

items.synopsis: As more examples of the unlawful confinement of youth detainees come to light, it's time to end the vicious cycle, writes state political reporter Keane Bourke.

title.children: Imagine being locked in a tiny room for days. For these teenagers, it's reality

image.altText: A Vietnamese Australian man smiles with his hands embracing his smiling wife.

items.synopsis: Australian man Chau Van Kham says his faith and the support of his family and community helped him survive the past four-and-a-half years in detention in Vietnam.

title.children: Australian detained in Vietnam for more than four years opens up about how he survived in prison

image.altText: A smiling young man with a beard dressed in high vis pulls a beer from a tap from behind a bar.

items.synopsis: It's a long trek from anywhere, but Ongerup in Western Australia — population 114 — has a community that refuses to let the town die.

title.children: Why this small WA community banded together to buy the pub, supermarket, cafe and petrol station

image.altText: Stephen Nutt

items.synopsis: Death threats from suspected foreign agents are a common occurrence in Australia's multicultural communities but the Australian Federal Police says they haven't been able to lay any charges in five years.

title.children: AFP 'not up to scratch' as zero charges laid for foreign interference through social media

image.altText: A man wearing a cream-coloured sweater sitting on a white sofa inside a house

items.synopsis: The former One Direction star was interviewed by Alex Cooper, the host of Call Her Daddy, one of Spotify's most-streamed podcasts. These were the biggest moments he revealed.

title.children: Zayn Malik opens up about One Direction departure in first interview in six years

image.altText: A man in high-vis and a helmet on an e-scooter on a city street.

items.synopsis: Petition for heavier and more powerful e-scooters in WA after riders call out "unreasonable" laws.

title.children: If you can buy a car that can do 300kph, why not a faster e-scooter? Perth riders push for change

image.altText: A man being taken into custody by NSW police.

items.synopsis: A 22-year-old man is charged with murder over the shooting death in May of a 24-year-old man in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: 'He has blood on his hands': Sydney man charged over alleged gangland shooting murder

image.altText: Large lettering on a boundary wall saying "Townsville University Hospital".

items.synopsis: Townsville University Hospital reviewed the cases of hundreds of children who were screened or given cochlear implants at its paediatric audiology department and found clinical standards had not been met in dozens of instances.

title.children: Hospital 'deeply sorry' after failures in specialist unit found to have affected dozens of children

image.altText: A woman stands in a doctor's coat, holding a silicone implant.

items.synopsis: An Ohio plastic surgeon's state medical licence is revoked after a medical board determined she harmed patients while live streaming their surgeries.

title.children: Plastic surgeon who streamed procedures on TikTok banned from practising in Ohio

image.altText: man with black beanie, brown coat and glasses sits on bed on flatbed ute with pet dog

items.synopsis: In only four months, the Wimmera's only homelessness outreach worker has found more than 60 rough sleepers. Injured abattoir worker Shane is one of them — and the number of people like him is expected to "explode".

title.children: Shane sleeps on a ute tray at night. He pretends he's camping to save face

image.altText: Rho Ophiuchi cloud complex, with brightly-coloured space plumes of space dust and stars

items.synopsis: The James Webb Space Telescope has given us another stunning image, this time revealing a close up a stellar nursery.

title.children: NASA's 'chaotic' new image reveals detail undetectable to the human eye

image.altText: A 3D model of the building that burnt down in Surry Hills

items.synopsis: The century-old former hat factory caught fire on a Thursday afternoon. Within seven minutes of the first triple-0 call, the entire building, in the most densely populated part of Sydney, was an inferno.

title.children: Unravelling the inferno that reduced this century-old former hat factory to rubble

image.altText: A young man wearing a yellow hi-vis vest stands behind a parcel cart looking to his left.

items.synopsis: Michael Richardson has Down syndrome, hearing loss and could not read — but he would not let that stop him landing a job at Australia Post.

title.children: Michael could only read small words four years ago. Now he is working at Australia Post

image.altText: Images of round metallic objects known as spherules

items.synopsis: Scientists from Harvard University have collected fragments believed to belong to a huge interstellar meteor, but PNG officials say the research was conducted within their waters without the required permits.

title.children: An exciting discovery leads to controversy as Harvard scientists collect fragments from interstellar meteor

image.altText: Huw Edwards holding a sheet of paper sitting at a news desk

items.synopsis: The BBC presenter facing allegations he paid a young person thousands of pounds for sexually explicit photos is Huw Edwards, the BBC reports, citing a statement from his wife.

title.children: Highest-paid journalist at BBC, Huw Edwards, named as presenter accused of paying for explicit teen photos

image.altText: People board a plane from the tarmac.

items.synopsis: The new carrier will cut routes and slash the number of flights to some destinations, saying it wants to improve reliability while citing a lack of "sustainable demand".

title.children: Budget airline Bonza scraps five routes in bid to 'earn trust' of Aussie travellers

image.altText: Putin KGB zelenskyy composite

items.synopsis: Vladimir Putin had already proved himself NATO's greatest recruiter, and this week's summit in Lithuania highlights just how heavily sought-after the exclusive club has become, writes John Lyons.

title.children: How the NATO summit showed off Zelenskyy's power and the lingering fear of KGB ideals

image.altText: composite garside and former partner

items.synopsis: Harry Garside's ex-girlfriend is charged with assault and stalking, a month after the Olympian's domestic assault case was dropped by police.

title.children: Former girlfriend of boxer Harry Garside charged with domestic violence offences

image.altText: A woman and a child.

items.synopsis: Foodbank Australia is calling for more funding for school breakfast programs, with a growing number of families struggling to send children to school with full bellies.

title.children: Mum-of-10 forced to cut back on school lunches as food prices 'out of control'

image.altText: Fighters of Wagner private mercenary group pose for a picture.

items.synopsis: Russian mercenary group Wagner reportedly hands over its weapons. What's next for the fighters and their leader after June's mutiny?

title.children: Wagner has handed over its weapons to Russia's military. What's next for the mercenary group?
